text: #Covid19 has catalyzed a pandemic of grief that can only be lessened by recognizing our losses. Please join me in supporting @MarkedByCovid 's work to secure official #CovidMemorialDay and #CovidMemorials at city, state, and federal levels. >>>

George Edward Mckibben 4.14.43 - 4/7/20 “My dad was a hero and a trailblazer! He inspired so many students as one of the first black teachers in Clayton County Georgia. His positive spirit and pure joy for life has left a huge hole in many hearts.” http://MarkedByCovid.com/remember

Thank you. And thank you for creating a space for folks to come together in grief and honoring the dead. I am planning to let her know about @MarkedByCovid to see if she would want to connect with other folks impacted by COVID.
He died yesterday. And her brother has COVID now, as well. Wild that hospitals are doing this to patients and their families. “Do harm” is the new slogan for most healthcare workers I guess.

THANK YOU ⁦ @KeckMedUSC ⁩ for protecting #HighRiskCovid and disabled people in your facilities by preserving masking indoors. I get weekly IV treatment for #LongCovid here and masks mean I can show up w/o undue fear & stress.

Popping on here with a sweet reminder that you can sign up to gift or receive a gifted copy of The #LongCovid Survival Guide via our book exchange here: https://forms.gle/ejx7BGcqNbfXvQQf9… We've already sent out dozens of books and we want to send more, so share with your friends :)
#MarkedByCOVID
Arnold Kronfeld - 4.3.20 “He was loved.” Honor your loved ones lost to Covid with #MarkedByCovid's #NationalCovidMemorial: http://MarkedByCovid.com/remember

Facts: real recognizes real. As I was speaking with a group of advocates re: #LongCovid & need for robust research, support, patient-led leadership, and awareness this message came in over chat. It was such a needed boost to my weary soul. @MarkedByCovid
#DavosSafe for me, not thee.

His failure to report the flights appears to violate a law passed after Watergate that requires justices, judges, members of Congress and federal officials to disclose most gifts, two ethics law experts said. Stunning reporting here. ⁦ @propublica ⁩

Seriously. Abolition is about preventing & interrupting harm. Masks prevent & interrupt ongoing harms of 400 reported (likely much higher) COVID deaths/day & 1/4 chance of long COVID that increases w/each infection. We are never getting to abolitionist futures if we can’t do this

“Researchers have been able to narrow down the prevalence of #LongCovid to about 5-10% of children.” Some experts had estimated as little as 1%.. to 20%. “The truth is somewhere in between,” Dr. Roberta DeBiasi, Children’s National Hospital in Washington.
Are you Generation Z? Curious to know your take on this article and why you are or are not a milk drinker.
The building was on fire and the guards walked away leaving dozens of people to die. This is cruel and unusual punishment at the hands of US immigration policy.

She raises a good point. A mask can definitely make you feel "other". I know. I'm the only person in a mask everywhere I go locally. But chronic illness makes you feel "other" permanently. And trust me, temporary social discomfort beats a permanent struggle. #COVID19 #MaskUp

When people discover shocking “new” facts about the friendly pandemic virus we’re cheerfully “coexisting with,” you can bet the chronically ill & those of us who were already disabled by Covid have been aware of it for at least 3 years. The warnings were labeled “fear-mongering.”
Watch the first in a series of special reports by @staceypooleITV on the children living with Long Covid.

The NRA buys off Congress. No action on guns. The oil industry buys off Congress. No action on climate. Insurance companies buy off Congress. No action on health care. The list goes on... Money in politics is the root of our dysfunction.
Here’s @RepOgles and his family. He’s the Member of Congress who represents the Covenant School.
America has always been about white men having their way.

Three children shot and killed. As we wait for more details, our hearts are with the families and the community in Nashville. No child should go to school in fear of being shot. Adults are failing kids.

Today someone asked me why I was wearing a mask. Was I just worried about a new variant? Was I vaccinated? He was shocked when I told him that: -60 percent of Americans dying from covid are vaccinated -it's the 3rd leading cause of death across age groups -covid never went away

Like most people, I don’t like to feel like an “other.” At the same time, I don’t want to get sick AND I believe that people who are disabled and immunocompromised belong. So the choice is easy and the Aura doesn’t bother my face while giving a snug fit. @MarkedByCovid
Sixteen young people from Montana have sued the state, arguing that its support of fossil fuels violates the state Constitution that guarantees “the right to a clean and healthful environment.”
I heard people saying Salesforce Tower was the tallest structure in San Francisco. Sorry honey, but I'll always be the queen of the skyline.

Long COVID Awareness Day. Because of Long COVID I cannot work, research, teach, or write within my academic field. This is my fourth year of Long COVID. I have not recovered. I want to regain my health and return to work. #LongCOVIDAwarenessDay #LongCOVID

This is not what life at 25 should look like. I haven’t been able to leave the house for months. I miss the little things, I miss the big things. I miss living. This disease affects millions. We need more research now. #LongCovid #LongCovidAwarenessDay by Lin Woldendorp

This is me just before #LongCovid. I was a world traveling, award winning writer and professor. I spent my days writing, having fun with friends, and being an active mom. Now, 3 years later, I can barely walk a 1/4 mile and have to lay down after I shower. #LongCovidAwarenessDay

It's International #LongCOVIDAwarenessDay! Tell us what #LongCOVID Awareness means to you! What awareness of Long COVID & its associated conditions (#LCAC) do you want to see in the world? Share a 1-2 min video or a few sentences describing what http://bit.ly/3FqoUDn… Show more

My Mom has no balance: she falls over every day. 3 years & thousands of dollars later we still don't have answers. It started with Covid...along with fatigue, digestion issues... What's your #longCovid story? #LongCovidAwarenessDay @MarkedbyCovid

Today is #LongCovidAwarenessDay This was my last solo backpacking trip before I got sick in 2020. I was 27 & walked 40 miles in two days. Now I’m lucky to make it through a half day of work. I’ve had two surgeries & am one of millions disabled by #LongCovid #ME

Dear @PeoplesCDC : How do we contact you? Sincerely, The People [Context: Over the past several months, we've submitted several inquiries via your "contact us" form, info@ email, and more...but no response.]

. @POTUS is making the wrong decision approving the Willow Project. Our beautiful federal lands and indigenous communities will be harmed when they need to be protected. It's time we plan for the clean energy future instead of continuing on the path of fossil fuels.

. @SecDebHaaland has been an incredible champion for Native issues & our leadership. That said, Native ppl must be treated w/ equity & the Native Village of Nuiqsut has made their position clear, they do not consent on the Willow project. @Interior must listen & #StopWillow
I am with all the advocates who oppose this disastrous decision to approve the Willow Project and will continue fighting alongside them to put our people and our planet ahead of Big Oil profits.

. @POTUS is wrong. The approval of a massive oil development project on federal lands is a mistake we will regret for generations. The Willow project’s devastating consequences will be suffered by all of us. We must move forward not backward.

. @POTUS pledged to end new drilling on federal lands. This disastrous decision to approve the Willow Project in Alaska, one of the largest oil development projects in decades, will have devastating consequences on our planet, frontline communities, and wildlife.
. @kdurquiza : No sitting President or Governor has met with a delegation of the COVID-bereaved. #CovidMemorialDay

Those in power have normalized mass death from COVID, but if there was more room to grieve & hear surviving loved ones’ stories, perhaps there wouldn’t be so much societal numbness, apathy & eroding compassion. This #CovidMemorialDay online vigil is heartbreaking and powerful.
“Sharing our stories connects us all in healing.” #CovidMemorialDay @MarkedByCovid
“I feel like I’m in a nightmare, and I haven’t woken up yet.” —Dale from Alabama #CovidMemorialDay @MarkedByCovid
. @EdMarkey : “This pandemic is not yet over in the U.S. or across the world.” “We have to continue to build in the protections.” #CovidMemorialDay @MarkedByCovid

. @EdMarkey speaking so much truth: “The fight for health justice and climate justice must be intertwined.” He emphasizes the disproportionate injustices of this pandemic, addresses Long COVID, and talks about the need to center the most vulnerable. #CovidMemorialDay

Appreciate seeing @SenWarren in @MarkedByCovid ’s online vigil on #COVIDMemorialDay — we need more leaders to acknowledge the grief & pain of the millions of lives lost & changed by this ongoing pandemic.
. @kdurquiza : “Solidarity is simply turning care into action.” #CovidMemorialDay
“Solidarity is just turning care into action.” - @kdurquiza at tonight’s @MarkedByCovid #CovidMemorialDay vigil
This was deeply moving. Please help support a #CovidMemorialDay . The current Congressional push is for the first Monday in March. Follow the links to see how you can help shepard it through.
Join me in a virtual vigil tonight at 6pm AZ time. In order to heal, we must remember and mark our losses.

Last week Easthampton, Northampton, and Amherst city councils all passed resolutions in support of a statewide Covid Memorial Day. This supports HD.3821 sponsored by State Representative @MindyForMA and @repblais and supported by @MarkedByCovid

I encourage you to sign up for the zoom COVID Memorial Day tonight at 8 pm eastern. Spend some time honoring all those we’ve lost in the past three years. I know it’s hard to think about but healing can only begin when we face these ongoing tremendous losses.
Tonight. Vigil for #CovidMemorialDay. Appearances by @ewarren and others. Let’s show up for people suffering from Long Covid, vulnerable people, and all those who have lost someone. #CovidIsntOver
#CovidMemorialDay online vigil. Tonight (8 pm ET.) @MarkedByCovid @kdurquiza

AND!!! @GovernorHobbs will be the first gov in the nation to formally observe #CovidMemorialDay and attend an event spearheaded by the Covid-bereaved community when she joins us at the @AZHistSociety on Monday. https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdqBwC2USGqpBup1m7MdlEUGnXplkjFoKLHYxFFmyhq1l58Zw/viewform…

. @SenWarren & @RepGregStanton will also re-introduce legislation to recognize #CovidMemorialDay on the 1st Monday of March... ...This time, with bipartisan support to ensure that remembering our loved ones doesn’t become a political football. https://washingtonpost.com/dc-md-va/2021/07/31/covid-memorial-day-congress-victims/…

Millions of people in this country have lost loved ones to Covid, and hundreds more continue to join their ranks each day. This is the first time that leaders of this stature will participate in a community-driven Covid memorial event.

RSVP now for @MarkedByCovid 's 3rd annual #CovidMemorialDay ONLINE VIGIL. Hear from legislative champs @SenWarren and @RepGregStanton alongside activists, memorial-makers, and more. *Allies, please join in solidarity. MONDAY 3/6/23 at 8pm Eastern: http://covidmemorialday.org/vigil
Marching through Flatbush earlier. On Bridge now #MarchForTheDead #MarkedByCOVID

Irene Cordova 11.22.54 - 2.7.22 “My lovely older sister. Heaven gained a beautiful Angel. We will miss you, sister. ” Honor your loved ones lost to Covid with #MarkedByCovid's #NationalCovidMemorial: http://MarkedByCovid.com/remember

The group @MarkedByCovid is pushing for a COVID Memorial Day the first Monday of March. This year it falls on Monday, March 6th and they will have a virtual rally. You can make your own video or post sharing how you have been #MarkedByCovid and help amplify their important work.
#CovidMemorialDay March 6

Yesterday I was proud to join advocates from @MarkedByCovid and support @MindForMA and @repblais legislation to mark the first Monday in March “COVID Remembrance Day”. TY @DJVersailles and @jritzsullivan for your advocacy around this important topic.
BIG NEWS: Senator Liz Warren & Representative Greg Stanton are on board! Join our virtual #CovidMemorialDay vigil on 3.6.23 to hear directly from our legislative champions.
Thank you @kdurquiza and @MarkedByCovid

Yesterday, @MarkedByCovid led a local delegation of people to #SF City Hall @sfgov @LondonBreed to deliver our open letter on the ending public health emergency directly to law makers. Here's why, what happened, and how you can help: (1/

A delegation of activists descended upon City Hall yesterday to bring our concerns directly to lawmakers and deliver our open letter to each office. Multiple offices expressed appreciation and asked if this had anything to do with the calls they've been getting (YES!) (13/
Change is possible, folks. We don't have to settle for this. It's only possible though if you show up. Step One>>>Take Action>>>We made it easy! http://MarkedByCovid.com/DearSF (14/

Tomorrow, four Massachusetts @MarkedByCovid bereaved activists will head to Beacon Hill with members of @MassCOSH to talk to lawmakers in MA about the need to honor the people we lost to COVID-19 on the first Monday in March. Please show your support.

We're up to SEVEN official organizational #DearSF endorsers! Extra-special thank you to: @sdaction1 #RadioSF @HumanImpact_HIP @rootsempowers @publichealthjc @patientled @StratHighImpact

GREAT NEWS! We just got off of a call with @CAPublicHealth and they have NOT removed the mask requirement in healthcare settings! This means masks are still required for all in hospitals, doctors' offices, & more #KeepMasksinHealthcareCA @NohaAboelataMD @CalNurses

YES! In just over 24 hours we've generated 7,488 letters, 4 organizational supporters, and our first media hit! A heartfelt THANK YOU to @sdaction1 , @HumanImpact_HIP , #RadioSF, and @RootsEmpowers for being our inaugural organizational endorsers! Lots of ways to get involved

“It is year four of the pandemic, & we still have no treatments, support or public warning for the most common adverse outcome from infection — #LongCovid” Spoke to @abc7newsbayarea how moving beyond covid without treatments for LC is simply impossible.

What does poverty alleviation look like? Like this. #prevention #homeless #homelessness #CovidIsNotOver #longCOVID

As Covid health emergencies come to an end next week, people dealing with long Covid, and other impacts from the virus, are feeling feel isolated and concerned. Thanks to @oliviah0808 and @kdurquiza for sharing their stories:

The Public Health Emergency may be ending, but the Crisis is not over. Calling on individuals and organizations to sign on to this excellent letter to SF leadership asking for continued protections for us all - but especially for the most vulnerable among us.
Please send a #DearSF letter to Mayor @LondonBreed and the San Francisco Board of Supervisors to ask them to protect the nation's safety nets.
URGENT! We’re about to lose critical housing, food, public safety, & medical services. On 2/28, the #SanFrancisco Public Health Emergency will expire, taking critical safety nets with it.

[TONIGHT] Feb. 21. Join @MarkedByCovid on zoom for a SF Emergency Meeting at 8:00pm to get on the ground floor of our justice and equity recovery plan #DearSF. @sdaction1 @TenantsUnionSF @TenantsTogether #NoEvictions Register >>>

I just invited @GovernorHobbs @KatieHobbs to join us for Covid Memorial observations at @AZHistSociety on March 6 #CovidMemorialDay Dejavu moment: I started @MarkedByCovid with a letter to @DougDucey to see Covid grief at dad's funeral. #Arizona

I’ve received FOUR emails over the last 24 hours from ill students. 2 who’ve been to the ER & 2 who’ve had positive COVID tests. What the fuck are we doing? I’m so sad for my students who’ve been failed by so many “leaders.” And I’m so glad I’m teaching online. #PublicHealthFail
Black women belong in the US Senate. California, let’s go!!! While I love Katie and Adam’s a good one. There is only ONE ⁦ @RepBarbaraLee ⁩ ⁦ @BarbaraLeeForCA ⁩ #SheSpeaksforMe #california
It's a disservice to discuss social determinants of health without discussing who is doing the determining, why, how those decisions affect people, and how to change the power dynamic.
Leadership in healthcare does exist. Thank you @WeillCornell #KeepMasksInHealthCare #KeepMasksinHealthcareNY Protect the #immunocompromised people. #CovidIsNotOver

I’m wondering if people know more about this at a national level. How many people will be impacted financially when the COVID public health emergency ends? People talk about access to vaccines and testing. How will emergency rental assistance and food stamps (SNAP) be impacted?
But the elephant in the room is—eviction protection is tied to the public health emergency—if her tenants can’t pay this month, how are they going to pay next? Especially if no one knows.

Also, still thinking about how City Attorney David Chiu shared how they reluctantly sued the Biden administration for an issue. We need our city to stand firm to ALL politicians not looking out for the public’s best interest.
These landlords asked about reimbursement $$ from pandemic rent relief. There is a long waiting list to process payments, they have been waiting for 16 months.

Wondering if @SFPDRichmond has lost any officers to Covid. Sadly, Covid-19 was the #1 killer of cops for the third year in a row. Read up >>> https://npr.org/2022/01/12/1072411820/law-enforcement-deaths-2021-covid…
Thank you! #BringBackMasks
Lots of talk about civil and workers rights protections…but no mention of right to clean air. we’ve got so much work to do.
I asked a question about accessibility of public spaces to disabled, elderly, and immunocompromised folks to clean indoor air. Total skirting of that and a focus on following science.
Up best is @SFCityAttorney — he forgot his mask as well.
Thread

Are you tuning into the @hhs briefing at the end of the Covid-19 public health emergency? My first thought: to celebrate #BlackHistoryMonth we should be fixing health inequities, which will be further exacerbated once the PHE expires. #BlackLivesMatter https://kff.org/policy-watch/how-recognizing-health-disparities-for-black-people-is-important-for-change/…
Cha adds additional context about observations for new expected variants and its potential impacts on vaccines and treatements.

Take away: If you're concerned about covid, talk to your local elected officials. Feels like June 2020 to me. I'm going to a town hall on Wednesday to raise concerns in #SF Need an idea on how to get active? Start by signing and sharing this petition.
There is absolutely NO discussion of different social programs that the end of the Public Health Emergency such as increase in SNAP benefits or eviction protections.
Q1: Will staff be required to test in long-term care facilities. A1: There will be some requirements, sunsetting most guidance. Not super clear = elders dying, IMHO.

Have you signed @TogetherWeMask & @MarkedByCovid petition re: Public Health Emergency? >>> https://actionnetwork.org/petitions/oppose-ending-the-national-and-public-health-emergency-declarations-2?source=direct_link&referrer=group-marked-by-covid…

. @CMSGov reinforces the top line message, "we're in a better place and we've been preparing for this for awhile." <<We know>> Telehealth will continue until 12/24 if they meet certain requirements. Why wouldn't we make it as easy as possible for high-risk people to receive care?
They have questions! Jump on and ask some hard-hitting questions. Link >>> https://zoomgov.com/webinar/register/WN_02Kf51X7TUObATW5r9A0PA…

Stephen Cha starts off by saying the government is being nice and giving us 90 days over 60 days and that there is a factsheet/roadmap for a "smooth transition." @MarkedByCovid https://hhs.gov/about/news/2023/02/09/fact-sheet-covid-19-public-health-emergency-transition-roadmap.html…

Cha continues to share that REPORTING WILL CHANGE. Without data we will be flying blind. How can we collectively respond if we don't know what's going on? What happens if/when there is a variant that breaks through vaccines? Why would we hamstring ourselves like this?
My Dad should be watching #SuperBowlLVII right now but instead he's dead from Covid and that makes me really sad. @MarkedByCovid

My office will continue to require masks for those who can. Because we want it to be safe for babies. And our high risk patients. And their parents who might be high risk. And our staff. #MasksWork #MasksSaveLives #NYC @HealthNYGov @nycHealthy @NYCHealthCommr @GovKathyHochul

"Why would the President, why would the governor, say it's safe if it's not?" Kristin Urquiza ( @kdurquiza ), Co-Founder of @MarkedByCovid , recounts how the premature reopening of Arizona affected her ability to keep her parents safe. Hear her story in 2020 CHAOS AND HOPE.

I've googled "How many people died from Covid in the USA today" a thousand times. I always find myself going back in time to June 30, 2020 -- the day my Dad died from Covid -- and resting my marker on that date, thinking about the 1,300 deaths in his day cohort. @MarkedByCovid

Not all heroes wear capes but they do wear a well-fitted N95 (or similar model) during an airborne pandemic. Thank you, Alex, for modeling humility. It won't bring back my Dad (who died from Covid early on) but it will save someone else's loved one. @MarkedByCovid

This week: Briefing on what's found on my son's electronics. It took over a year to get forensics done on it, but it is a movement forward. Also, I'm pushing hard to get forensics done on the Jeep and everything related, clothing & boots. They may yield more answers. It's a must!
